page.title: 09CORSTON FARM HUNDLETON
page.content: This farm has 500 acres and grazes 250 cows. 96 of these are young Herefords, there is a Hereford bull and 47 calves. The rest are Friesians. There is a wide range of machinery, a mower, a baler, a plough, a rotovator, a fertiliser-drill, a roller, a hedge-trimmer, a yard-scraper and a silage-trailer. Three tractors are used - Ford 6610, 4600 and 3610. The working manager Mr. Douglas Havard runs the farm with 2 cowmen, Roger Callaghan and Peter Jenkins and a tractor driver Chris Jones. F. Hiam Ltd. are the owners. Calves are taken to Pembroke Mart on Wednesdays. The farm grows barley and grass for silage. 5500 litres of milk are sold every day. In the dairy are 3 bulk tanks for milk. The milking-parlour holds 24 cows, 12 are milked at a time.
